definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: Dirty air or air-borne garbage causes stinging eyes and running nose.
sentences.chinese: 肮脏的空气或空气传播的垃圾引起眼睛刺痛和流鼻涕。

sentences.english: So in the case of a long-running nose, it's best to let each nose run its course.
sentences.chinese: 因此在长期流鼻涕的情况下，最好不管它。

sentences.english: Common cold symptoms are runny nose, sore throat and headache.
sentences.chinese: 一般的感冒症状也就是流流鼻涕，喉咙疼和头疼。

sentences.english: I have a runny nose and a scratchy throat.
sentences.chinese: 我流鼻涕，嗓子还又疼又哑。

sentences.english: The more common symptoms are nasal discharge , poor appetite, and lethargy.
sentences.chinese: 比较常见的征状是流鼻涕，食欲不佳以及昏睡。

sentences.english: I'm sneezing and my nose is running.
sentences.chinese: 我打喷嚏而且还流鼻涕。

sentences.english: I feel sick today, because I have a headache and a runny nose.
sentences.chinese: 今天我生病了，因为我头疼还流鼻涕。

sentences.english: Are You a Sneezer, Wheezer, Sniffer, or Dripper?
sentences.chinese: 你会打喷嚏，喘息，用鼻子吸气或流鼻涕吗？

sentences.english: He doesn't enjoy the company of snotty-nosed children.
sentences.chinese: 他不喜欢跟流鼻涕的孩子一起玩。

sentences.english: Manatee fat is widely available to aid runny noses.
sentences.chinese: 治疗流鼻涕的海牛油随处都可以买到。

sentences.english: we got a bad headache, and my nose is running.
sentences.chinese: 我头痛得厉害，还流鼻涕。

sentences.english: Stuffy nose is commonly present with a cold and typically resolves spontaneously within a week.
sentences.chinese: 感冒时流鼻涕很常见，一般而言一周左右会自愈。

sentences.english: Girl: So my runny nose doesn't gross you out?
sentences.chinese: 那我流鼻涕，你不会觉得恶心了？

sentences.english: I got a bad headache , and my nose is running.
sentences.chinese: 我头痛的厉害，还流鼻涕。

sentences.english: His cough has slackened, but his nose is still running.
sentences.chinese: 他的咳嗽轻了，但鼻子仍在流鼻涕。

definition: to catch cold/(common) cold/CL:場|场[chang2],次[ci4]/(coll.) to be interested in (often used in the negative)/(Tw) to detest/can't stand

pinyin: shang4 hu1 xi1 dao4 gan3 ran3

definition: to have a high temperature (from illness)/to have a fever
